concept.title: Data Collection Using Data Warehouse
concept.shortdesc: A description of how data is collected in data warehouse.

conbody.p: Data warehouse requests use the following data collection process:

ol.li: An image request is sent to Adobe data collection servers.
A server call is returned to acknowledge the server call.
Collection servers submit the data to a cache file.
Adobe determines whether Data warehouse is enabled for the report suite.

If enabled, the data is sent to a container to be stored for a period as defined in your contract.
When the data is stored, you can use data warehouse and segment interface to create reports on the stored data.
The data is submitted to processing, first processing VISTA rules and GeoSegmentation location.
The data is submitted to tables for viewing in reports.

conbody.p: If data warehouse is enabled, data is duplicated and sent to both the processed data tables and to the data storage unit for the report suite. You can enable data warehouse only for data storage purposes. Frequently, users enable data warehouse to create advanced data relationship reports through the reporting interface.

For example, you run a company that sells computers, and you want to see the number of visitors to a certain page and who also purchased a certain printer. The data warehouse interface can access the raw data from the data storage container and create a post-analysis data report, which Adobe sends to a selected email address.
